description: Office application called wmic to proxye execution through a LOLBIN process. This is often used to break suspicious parent-child chain (Office app spawns LOLBin).
author: Vadim Khrykov
Cyb3rEng
name: Suspicious WMIC Execution Via Office Process
query: (process.parent.executable.text:("*\\WINWORD.EXE" OR "*\\EXCEL.EXE" OR "*\\POWERPNT.exe" OR "*\\MSPUB.exe" OR "*\\VISIO.exe" OR "*\\MSACCESS.EXE" OR "*\\EQNEDT32.EXE" OR "*\\ONENOTE.EXE" OR "*\\wordpad.exe" OR "*\\wordview.exe") AND ((process.executable.text:"*\\wbem\\WMIC.exe") OR (winlog.event_data.OriginalFileName:"wmic.exe")) AND (process.command_line.text:"*process*" AND process.command_line.text:"*create*" AND process.command_line.text:"*call*" AND process.command_line.text:("*regsvr32*" OR "*rundll32*" OR "*msiexec*" OR "*mshta*" OR "*verclsid*" OR "*wscript*" OR "*cscript*")))
